definitions.text: a place within a region identified relative to a center or reference location
examples: they always sat on the right side of the church
he never left my side

definitions.text: one of two or more contesting groups
examples: the Confederate side was prepared to attack

definitions.text: either the left or right half of a body
examples: he had a pain in his side

definitions.text: a surface forming part of the outside of an object
examples: he examined all sides of the crystal
dew dripped from the face of the leaf

definitions.text: an extended outer surface of an object
examples: he turned the box over to examine the bottom side
they painted all four sides of the house

definitions.text: an aspect of something (as contrasted with some other implied aspect)
examples: he was on the heavy side
he is on the purchasing side of the business
it brought out his better side

definitions.text: a line segment forming part of the perimeter of a plane figure
examples: the hypotenuse of a right triangle is always the longest side
he gets his brains from his father's side

definitions.text: a lengthwise dressed half of an animal's carcass used for food
an opinion that is held in opposition to another in an argument or dispute
examples: there are two sides to every question
he climbed the steep slope
the house was built on the side of a mountain

definitions.text: (sports) the spin given to a ball by striking it on one side or releasing it with a sharp twist
